intro: Zeuxine pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy wildflowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a soft, velvety texture. Zeuxine pulchra typically grows in moist, shady habitats and is often found in alpine meadows.
